data.title: Subject Guide: Jewish Nobel Prize Laureates
data.meta_description: Archival and library highlights found at the Center relating to Nobel Prize winners throughout history.
data.text:
Some of the laureates featured in our collections:

Shmuel Yosef Agnon

The 1966 Nobel Prize in Literature was divided equally between Agnon "for his profoundly characteristic narrative art with motifs from the life of the Jewish people" and Nelly Sachs.

Archive highlights:

Shmuel Joseph Agnon Collection (LBIJER 333) [Collection is digitized and available online.]

Ofra D. Core Collection (AR 25421) [Collection is digitized and available online.]

This collection contains a handwritten poem by Agnon, written for Uri Bergmann.

Papers of Israel Elfenbein (1890-1964) Collection (RG 773)

Found in Series I, Subseries 11 are letters written to and from Agnon.

Library highlights:

Only yesterday / by Shmuel Yosef Agnon ; translated from the Hebrew by Barbara Harshav. Princeton University Press, 2000.

A study in the evolution of S.Y. Agnon's style / by Joseph Kaspi. Spertus College of Judaica Press, 1972.

Shmuel Yosef Agnon : a revolutionary traditionalist / by Gershon Shaked ; translated by Jeffrey M. Green. New York University Press, 1989.

Elias Canetti

The 1981 Nobel Prize in Literature was awarded to Canetti "for writings marked by a broad outlook, a wealth of ideas and artistic power."

Archive highlights:

Elias Canetti Collection 1963-1994 (AR 2299)

Eli Rothschild Collection, 1986 (AR 5456) [Collection is digitized and available online.]

This collection contains Eli Rothschild’s correspondence with Elias Canetti regarding his book Das Augenspiel.

Rahel Sanzara Collection (AR 25057) [Collection is digitized and available online.]

This collection contains a letter from Canetti to Klaus-Peter Hinze, regarding Jewish author Ernst Weiss.

Hagenberggasse 49 : Memories of a Viennese Jewish childhood (ME 1068) [Collection is digitized and available online.]

Sonia Wachstein writes about her life, including her friendship with Elias Canetti. [Part of the LBI Memoir Collection.]

Elias Canetti (Besso Reel 166). Audio from Buenos Días América program (L.A. Division of the Voice of America) on March 25, 1971, discussing Canetti. [Collection is digitized and available online.]

Library highlights:

The memoirs of Elias Canetti / by Elias Canetti. Farrar, Straus and Giroux, 1999

Elias Canetti : Biographie / by Sven Hanuschek. Hanser, 2005.

Elias Canetti : Bilder aus seinem Leben / Edited by Kristian Wachinger. Hanser, 2005.

Nadine Gordimer

The 1991 Nobel Prize in Literature was awarded to Gordimer "who through her magnificent epic writing has - in the words of Alfred Nobel - been of very great benefit to humanity."

Archive highlights:

Bernard Gotfryd Papers (RG 1380).

This collection consists of photographs taken by Gotfryd and contains a photo of Gordimer.

Library highlights:

Die Cassirers : Unternehmer, Kunsthändler, Philosophen : Biographie einer Familie / by Sigrid Bauschinger. Verlag C.H. Beck, 2015.

Nicht ganz koscher : Stories für die Feiertage / Edited by Patricia Reimann. Deutscher Taschenbuch-Verlag, 2012.

Paul Johann Ludwig Heyse

The 1910 Nobel Prize in Literature was awarded to Heyse "as a tribute to the consummate artistry, permeated with idealism, which he has demonstrated during his long productive career as a lyric poet, dramatist, novelist and writer of world-renowned short stories."

Archive highlights:

Paul Heyse Collection, 1878-1910 (AR 946) [Collection is digitized and available online.]

Jakob Freimann Collection, 1827-1937 (AR 3489) [Collection is digitized and available online.]

This collections contains letters and cards sent to Rabbi Jakob Freimann and Rabbi Wolf Feilchenfeld. This includes a letter from Heyse.

Portrait of Paul Heyse / oil painting by Eduard Magnus. circa 1860. [Collection is digitized and available online.]

Library highlights:

Der Briefwechsel zwischen Paul Heyse und Hermann Levi : eine kritische Edition / by Julia Bernhardt. Dr. Kovač, 2007.

"Du, von dem ich lebe!" : Briefe an Paul Heyse / by Jacob Bernays ; edited by William M. Calder III und Timo Günther. Wallstein, 2010.

Paul Heyse : Nobel laureate in literature, 1910 / by John Henry Richter. n.p., 1970.

Elfriede Jelinek

The 2004 Nobel Prize in Literature was awarded to Jelinek "for her musical flow of voices and counter-voices in novels and plays that with extraordinary linguistic zeal reveal the absurdity of society's clichés and their subjugating power."

Archive highlights:

Rechnitz : Austria's dirty little secret : a rare interview with Nobel laureate Elfriede Jelinek. A lecture presented by YIVO and the Leo Baeck Institute, hosted by scholar Gitta Honegger. [Video is available online.]

Library highlights:

Elfriede Jelinek--"Ich will kein Theater" : mediale Überschreitungen / Edited by Pia Janke. Praesens Verlag, 2007.

Elfriede Jelinek : writing woman, nation, and identity : a critical anthology / Edited by Matthias Piccolruaz Konzett and Margarete Lamb-Faffelberger. Fairleigh Dickinson University Press, 2007.

Nelly Sachs

The 1966 Nobel Prize in Literature was divided equally between Sachs "for her outstanding lyrical and dramatic writing, which interprets Israel's destiny with touching strength" and Shmuel Yosef Agnon.

Archive highlights:

Nelly Sachs Collection (AR 3991) [Collection is digitized and available online.]

Nelly Sachs Autographs Collection, 1937-1967 (AR 3239) [Collection is digitized and available online.]

Nelly Sachs : die Dichterin und ihr Werk (MS 669) [Collection is digitized and available online.]

This is the transcript of a lecture about Sachs that was held at the Leo Baeck Institute New York on December 28, 1966.

Erika Guetermann Collection (AR 1893) [Collection is digitized and available online.]

This collection contains correspondence from Nelly Sachs to German-American journalist and poet, Erika Guetermann.

Miriam Merzbacher-Blumenthal Collection (AR 25701) [Collection is digitized and available online.]

Series III of this collection concerns Ilse Blumenthal-Weiss and contains correspondence between the German photographer and Nelly Sachs.

Library highlights:

Exhibit catalog, documenting the life and work of Nelly Sachs, Nobel laureate in literature, 1966 / New York Leo Baeck Institute, 1966.

"The space of words" : exile and diaspora in the works of Nelly Sachs / by Jennifer M. Hoyer. Camden House, 2014.

Nelly Sachs : die Opfer des Nationalsozialismus und die "Gejagten alle auf der Welt" / by Peter Selg. Verlag des Ita Wegman Instituts, 2017.

Isaac Bashevis Singer
